programme.title: Spectre
programme.desc: A cryptic message from the past leads James Bond (Daniel Craig) to Mexico City and Rome, where he meets the beautiful widow (Monica Bellucci) of an infamous criminal. After infiltrating a secret meeting, 007 uncovers the existence of the sinister organization SPECTRE. Needing the help of the daughter of an old nemesis, he embarks on a mission to find her. As Bond ventures toward the heart of SPECTRE, he discovers a chilling connection between himself and the enemy (Christoph Waltz) he seeks.

programme.title: What Would You Do?
programme.desc: Using hidden cameras, host John Quiñones observes and comments on how ordinary people behave when they are confronted with dilemmas that require them either to take action or to walk by and mind their own business. Various scenarios are created that force people to make split-second -- and often surprising -- decisions, and variations of the situation (such as changing the genders, races or clothing of the people involved) are often featured to see if different reactions are elicited. Examples of situations on the show include a waitress being harassed by her boss, and a drunken valet trying to park cars.

programme.title: World Series of Poker
programme.desc: Day 1A of the 2004 WSOP Main Event is underway with Daniel Negreanu, Men "The Master" Nguyen, and John Hennigan on the feature table. Defending champion Chris Moneymaker kicks off his title defense, while several big names find themselves heading home early.

programme.title: World Series of Poker
programme.desc: Coverage continues on Day 1B of the WSOP Main Event, and last year's runner-up Sammy Farha headlines the feature table along with John Juanda. Chris Ferguson and "Miami" John Cernuto then join the feature table action, as many poker pros hit the rail on Day 1B.

programme.title: World Series of Poker
programme.desc: Day 2 action in the WSOP Main Event sees Doyle Brunson headline the feature table along with Scott Fischman. Siblings Howard Lederer and Annie Duke are eliminated, along with two previous Main Event champions.

programme.title: World Series of Poker
programme.desc: Money day has arrived in the WSOP Main Event with just 277 players remaining on Day 3. Gus Hansen takes center stage on the feature table, and is joined by Daniel Alaei and Dan Harrington while two other previous champions also survive the day.

programme.title: World Series of Poker
programme.desc: Just 149 players remain in the 2004 WSOP Main Event, and Mike Matusow headlines the feature table alongside Greg "Fossilman" Raymer and John Esposito. However, it would be John Murphy, Josh Arieh, and Marcel Luske climbing to the top of the leaderboard.

programme.title: World Series of Poker
programme.desc: World Champions Dan Harrington and Chris Ferguson headline the feature table on Day 5 of the WSOP Main Event. The only other former champion wouldn't survive, as Doyle Brunson was eliminated.

programme.title: European Poker Tour
programme.desc: The European Poker Tour celebrates its 20th anniversary in Barcelona, the city where it all began. Nearly 2,000 players compete in the Main Event for a €1.5m first prize. EPT legends return to the tables and reigning champ Simon Wiciak looks to defend his title.

programme.title: European Poker Tour
programme.desc: Day 2 of the European Poker Tour Main Event continues, with PSPC champion Ramon Colillas, the USA's Rania Nasreddine and Canada's Griffin Benger among the players hoping to survive the session and stay in contention for the title, trophy and €1.5m top prize.

programme.title: European Poker Tour
programme.desc: They're on the bubble in the European Poker Tour Main Event. The next six players to be eliminated will leave with nothing. The rest will be guaranteed a slice of the €9.5m prize pool. Can YouTube star Wolfgang Poker and Canadian pro Griffin Benger make it into the money?

programme.title: European Poker Tour - Episode 4
programme.desc: At the European Poker Tour’s 20th anniversary celebrations, there’s a throwback vibe in the Main Event. A player calling himself ‘The Eliminator’ is holding court at the feature table. Expect banter and bluffs, as this old school character competes for the €1.5m first prize. (4/11)

programme.title: European Poker Tour - Episode 5
programme.desc: Survival is the name of the game, with just over 100 players remaining in the European Poker Tour Main Event. Most of the €9.5m prize pool is still up for grabs, and reigning champ Simon Wiciak and Monte-Carlo finalist Rania Nasreddine can both make EPT history. (5/11)

programme.title: European Poker Tour - Episode 6
programme.desc: There’s €1.5m for the winner of this special anniversary edition of the European Poker Tour. As Day 4 of the Main Event continues, the USA’s Rania Nasreddine is put through the wringer and a new generation of poker talent starts to make its mark. (6/11)

programme.title: European Poker Tour - Episode 7
programme.desc: Only 40 players remain in the European Poker Tour Main Event, including reigning champion Simon Wiciak. Can the French pro go back-to-back? The competition is tough: chip leader Stephen Song and Monte-Carlo finalist Rania Nasreddine are also eyeing the €1.5m top prize. (7/11)

programme.title: European Poker Tour - Episode 8
programme.desc: In the late stages of this European Poker Tour Main Event, mistakes are starting to creep in. But there’s no margin for error, with millions still on the line. Among the final 23 are American pro Stephen Song and former EPT finalist Rania Nasreddine. (8/11)

programme.title: European Poker Tour - Episode 9
programme.desc: All eyes are on the USA’s Rania Nasreddine, as she tries to make back-to-back European Poker Tour final tables. Brazilian pro Fabiano Kovalski is another previous EPT finalist looking for a second chance at victory. The top prize in this tournament is €1.5m. (9/11)

programme.title: European Poker Tour - Episode 10
programme.desc: Nine remain in the Main Event. Two will make history.

programme.title: European Poker Tour - Episode 11
programme.desc: It's the final table of Main Event.

programme.title: Sinful Paradise: Welcome to Paradise

programme.title: Cut

programme.title: Lines of Allegiance

But when tragedy forces him to return, he finds the people he once cared for, have their own intentions for themselves.

programme.title: The House on Adams Drive
programme.desc: Sean is convinced the only way to keep the woman of his dreams happy is by obtaining as much money as possible. programme.title: The Barista

programme.title: Widower Syndrome

After a pit stop, Amanda and Alexandria disappear, and everyone is convinced he came to the park alone. A race of desperation to find the truth, may also reveal Xavier's own sanity.

programme.title: Breaking Free
programme.desc: When his wife is murdered in their own home, Joe, an undercover cop, spirals out of control with alcohol and substance abuse. When he's seen by an old girlfriend on the street, she helps him to heal his spirit, along with finding justice for his wife.

programme.title: Melted Lipstick
programme.desc: Magic comes with a steep price for a shrinking violet who’s given a special lipstick that has the power to transform her into anyone she desires.

programme.title: Suffocated
programme.desc: Lexxy, a female trapped, and bonded to a man who she feels can possibly be her husband, and father to her child, takes her on a ride with lies, deceit, and betrayal.

programme.title: Stick Up
programme.desc: Two old friends from high school who’ve decided to enter into the drug and sex trade begin to groom a pair of women to work under them.

programme.title: Sneaky Links

programme.title: The Calling

programme.title: The Green Grass
programme.desc: When a man’s money, success and power attracts attention, he must dig deep within himself to stop his life from spinning wildly out of control.

programme.title: The Frozen Hearts: A Love Story
programme.desc: A couple attempts to find their way back to each other after they suffer a traumatic loss. Can they do it? Or is it too late for them?

programme.title: The Perfect Challenge

Their children witness their parents' escalating conflicts, leading to a tumultuous breakdown. Though their children plead for unity, divorce looms. A family intervention, sparked by a heartfelt gift, forces them to confront their deep-seated love and the possibility of reconciliation.

programme.title: Droppin Bodies

But when Kelsey is tragically murdered by her boyfriend, Julia is left shattered and betrayed. Abandoned by a justice system that fails to bring her daughter's killer to account, she's forced to confront the darkness she once escaped.

programme.title: Toxic Friendz

programme.title: Deceptive Touch

Everything seems perfect until a shocking discovery about Ant's past threatens to unravel their idyllic life. As Cam digs for answers, passion turns into paranoia, and a twisted game of lies and manipulation threatens to destroy everything she thought she knew.

programme.desc: A deathbed request from an old friend sends Lucas to a neighboring town in search of the man's long-lost sweetheart.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: Lucas thinks he has seen a ghost when a young man, eerily similar to a man he killed in the Civil War, challenges him to a gunfight.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: Lucas agrees to take a job as an undercover agent and goes to investigate rumors of the sales of arms to renegade Indians. His life is endangered by the town drunk who stumbles onto his true identity.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: While Lucas is in Wyoming on the trail of a gang illegally selling weapons to the Indians, Mark stays with Miss Milly, where he suffers from loneliness and doubt with his father gone for 2 months.

programme.title: The Gene Autry Show
programme.desc: Pat's rooster leads Pat and Gene into an adventure at the county fair.

programme.title: The Gene Autry Show
programme.desc: An outlaw who killed a sheriff frames Randy Barker who depends upon Gene to clear his name.

programme.title: The Gene Autry Show
programme.desc: Gene discovers that the town gossip is far more dangerous than he seems.

programme.title: The Gene Autry Show
programme.desc: The owner of a seemingly jinxed stageline enlists Gene and Pat's help to find the real cause behind a series of robberies.

programme.title: Revolt at Fort Laramie
programme.desc: At the dawn of the American Civil War, tensions begin to mount between Northern and Southern sympathizers stationed at Fort Laramie in Wyoming. The Southern soldiers, led by Maj. Seth Bradner (John Dehner), leave Fort Laramie to join the Confederate cause. But when Bradner is captured by a fortune-seeking Sioux tribe en route to Texas, it's up to Capt. James Tenslip (Gregg Palmer), a Northerner who has fallen for Bradner's niece Melissa (Frances Helm), to save him.

programme.title: Fort Yuma
programme.desc: Apaches plan to attack a fort by wearing uniforms plundered from a cavalry officer's (Peter Graves) supply column.

programme.title: Fort Bowie
programme.desc: A group of Apaches visits a cavalry fort in hopes of laying down their weapons and coming to a peace agreement, but Maj. Wharton (J. Ian Douglas), wanting to make a name for himself, orders his men to massacre them. Meanwhile, Col. Garrett (Kent Taylor) believes his flirtatious wife is sleeping with Capt. Thompson (Ben Johnson), so he tries to get rid of the captain by ordering him to track Victorio (Larry Chance), a notorious Apache warrior who's plotting a large-scale attack on the fort.

programme.title: Fort Defiance
programme.desc: After the Civil War, veteran Ben Shelby (Ben Johnson) travels to Arizona to seek out fellow veteran Johnny Tallon (Dane Clark). After saving Johnny's blind brother, Ned (Peter Graves), from being trampled by a horse, Ben accompanies him to the family ranch. While Ben and Ned become friends, Ned's uncle grows suspicious about Ben's claim of friendship with Johnny. As they all wait for news of Johnny, they face an Indian attack and the arrival of vengeful former soldiers also seeking Johnny.

programme.title: Blood on the Moon
programme.desc: Down-and-out cowhand Jim Garry (Robert Mitchum) is asked by his old friend Tate Riling (Robert Preston) to help mediate a cattle dispute. When Garry arrives, however, it soon becomes clear that Riling has not been entirely forthright. Garry uncovers Riling's plot to dupe local rancher John Lufton (Tom Tully) out of a fortune. When Lufton's firecracker of a daughter, Amy (Barbara Bel Geddes), gets involved, Garry must choose between his old loyalties and what he knows to be right.

programme.title: The Good Guys and the Bad Guys
programme.desc: Older lawman Marshal Flagg (Robert Mitchum) is struggling to transition from the Old West to the more modernized one -- so much so that Mayor Wilker (Martin Balsam) forces him into retirement. Not one to go away easily, Flagg quickly fixates on his old nemesis, McKay (George Kennedy), formerly believed to be dead, who is now back in town and up to no good. But Flagg soon discovers that McKay might be his greatest ally in a fight to prove that the old-timers aren't useless in the New West.

programme.title: Return of the Bad Men
programme.desc: In 1889 in Oklahoma Territory, the land rush attracts thousands, including many outlaws. A gang led by Wild Bill Doolan includes the Sundance Kid (Robert Ryan) and the Younger brothers, who intend to take advantage of the confusion to rob banks. Doolan's daughter, Cheyenne (Anne Jeffreys), helps the gang in a heist, but is wounded and taken in by ex-ranger Vance Cordell (Randolph Scott). Vance sets about to change her allegiance, despite the misgivings of his fiancée (Jacqueline White).

programme.title: Carson City
programme.desc: After one too many successful stick-ups of the Carson City stagecoach by the Champagne Bandits, the local banker decides to build a railroad track through town. To do so, he'll need to employ the help of "Silent" Jeff Kincaid (Randolph Scott), the only man who can tunnel through the mountainous region. Unfortunately, Kincaid has more than just the mountains to deal with -- neither the locals nor the Champagne Bandits are happy about the new railway.

programme.title: Shoot-Out at Medicine Bend
programme.desc: Just discharged from service, Capt. Devlin (Randolph Scott) and his cavalry pals Maitland (James Garner) and Clegg (Gordon Jones) travel to Devlin's brother's home, but arrive to see the place overrun by American Indians. Devlin's sibling is killed because of his shoddy ammo, so the captain and his friends decide to hunt down the man who sold the bum bullets. They ride into town and find that the culprit is Clark (James Craig), a rich businessman who has the law in his pocket.

programme.title: There Was a Crooked Man
programme.desc: In a remote Arizona prison, a charming but ruthless criminal enlists his cellmates in an escape attempt with the promise of sharing his hidden loot.

programme.title: Westbound
programme.desc: A former Union officer, John Hayes (Randolph Scott) now manages a stagecoach company. However, Clay Putnam (Andrew Duggan), a businessman still loyal to the South, is intent on robbing the coaches operated by Hayes, which transport gold to the North from California. Hoping to heist the treasure as a way to revive the Confederacy, Putnam also has a grudge against Hayes, since his wife, Norma (Virginia Mayo), was once involved with the handsome Union soldier.

programme.title: The Legend of the Lone Ranger
programme.desc: The story of how the sole surviving Texas Ranger of an ambush by the Cavendish gang donned a mask and assumed a new identity as a justice warrior.

programme.title: The Cisco Kid
programme.desc: A rancher is shot to death while posing for a photograph and, as usual, the wrong person gets blamed. It's up to Cisco and Pancho to set things right.

programme.title: The Cisco Kid
programme.desc: Cisco and Pancho head south of the border to attend a wedding but get sidetracked by a damsel who's worried about her father.

programme.title: The Cisco Kid
programme.desc: Cisco and Pancho try to protect an old rancher who's carrying a sack full of money.

programme.title: The Cisco Kid
programme.desc: Cisco and Pancho encounter a fierce wild dog while on their way to a town to help a Frenchman and his daughter build a refrigeration plant.

programme.title: Stories of the Century
programme.desc: Matt and Margaret head to Denver in the late 1860's after the killing of a railroad telegraph operator. Bail jumper L H Musgrove, a known horse thief is their chief suspect.

programme.title: Stories of the Century
programme.desc: Railroad Detective Matt Clark (Jim Davis) and his assistant Frankie Adams (Mary Castle), investigate the stealing of a herd of horses belonging to the U. S. Cavalry.

programme.title: Seven Men From Now
programme.desc: A rancher (Randolph Scott) hunts down those responsible for killing his wife during a Wells Fargo holdup.

programme.title: Stories of the Century
programme.desc: Matt Clark sets out on the trail of a gang of cattle rustlers led by one of the West's youngest and most notorious outlaws, Billy Bonney, aka Billy the Kid.

programme.title: Stories of the Century
programme.desc: Matt Clark and his assistant pursue the vengeful James brothers, Frank and Jesse, who declare war on the law after their young half-brother is killed in a police ambush.

programme.title: Stories of the Century
programme.desc: The Detective goes after Apache chief Geronimo (Chief Yowlachie), who has been identified by Joe Burns (Emile Meyer), as the leader of a band of freight-car robbers.

programme.title: Stories of the Century
programme.desc: Matt and Frankie are asked by Colonel Marsham to infiltrate the vicious Quantrill gang. They do so on the eve of the Lawrence Kansas massacre that they are unable to prevent.

programme.title: Tombstone Territory
programme.desc: Sheriff Hollister and his men search for Geronimo, an Apache chief, after he attacks an army supply train just north of Tombstone.

programme.desc: After receiving a gunshot wound while running from Hollister's posse, a bank robber seeks medical attention and shelter.

programme.desc: Lucas looks for answers when recovering alcoholic Micah Torrence returns to the bottle and turns in his badge.

programme.title: The Rifleman

programme.title: The Rifleman

programme.title: Yancy Derringer
programme.desc: Derringer is falsely accused of complicity in a waterfront property theft. programme.title: Gina Yashere: Laughing to America
programme.desc: Live from San Francisco, UK's top black female comedian Gina Yashere brings her unique insider-outsider perspective on America's hottest news.

programme.title: Tommy Tiernan: Tomfoolery
programme.desc: Fresh off his role on the hit show Derry Girls, Irish comic Tommy Tiernan riffs on everything from medical exams to his failed career as a priest.

programme.title: Saul Trujillo: Yolanda
programme.desc: Does Variety's 'top comic to watch’ look like Selena's murderer? Find out why cruises are terrible and the homeless tent problem isn't what we think.

programme.title: Pete Correale: The Things We Do for Love
programme.desc: The comic, named one of Entertainment Weekly’s top ten to watch, who has dazzled on "The Tonight Show," "The Late Show," and more, shines once again.

programme.title: Pablo Francisco: Ouch! Live From San Jose!
programme.desc: ‘MADtv’ favorite Pablo Francisco shares hot takes on movies, music, celebrities, video games, obnoxious body piercings, and more in this comedy set.

programme.title: Bill Hicks: Reflections
programme.desc: Comedy Dynamics sits down with Bill Hicks’ brother, Steve, who tells old stories, squashes old rumors and reveals the brother and son behind the late comedian. Told amidst old and rare footage, it’s a must watch for any fan.

programme.title: Steve-O: Guilty as Charged
programme.desc: From his humble beginnings as a circus clown to becoming a star of the monster hit Jackass, comedian and author Steve-O has done it all—and then some.

programme.title: Maija DiGiorgio: Maija Pinion
programme.desc: The Def Comedy Jam and Comics Unleashed performer highlights the unique challenges in dating, family, and daily life as a mixed-race woman in America.

programme.title: Orlando Baxter: Glorified Baby Sitter
programme.desc: Boston-area comic Orlando Baxter stars in this stand-up set that goes back to his days as a teacher, shopping while Black, and laughs about life.

programme.title: Gina Brillon: Pacifically Speaking
programme.desc: Gabriel Iglesias presents an uproarious comedy special from the brash and beautiful comic, full of sharp jokes and her trademark Bronx attitude.

programme.title: Mike Birbiglia: What I Should Have Said Was Nothing
programme.desc: The comic performs.

programme.title: Rita Rudner: A Tale of Two Dresses
programme.desc: The famed Vegas headliner returns, as witty, insightful,and cutting as ever, as she riffs on life as a sixty-something in today's America.

programme.title: Shayne Smith: Prison for Wizards
programme.desc: Award-winning stand-up and former gang member Shayne Smith talks Azkaban prison tattoos, diabetic dogs, hacker moms, and more in this live special.

programme.title: Steve Treviño: 'Til Death
programme.desc: This hilarious comedy special includes Treviño’s take on living in Texas, as well as the daily joys and struggles of balancing marriage and kids.

programme.title: Steve-O: Guilty as Charged
programme.desc: From his humble beginnings as a circus clown to becoming a star of the monster hit Jackass, comedian and author Steve-O has done it all—and then some.

programme.title: Tammy Pescatelli's Way After School Special
programme.desc: The comic tells it like it is on stage at her old high school, where the former captain of the cheerleaders shows off her witty takes on the world.

programme.title: Russ Nagel: Uncle of Anarchy
programme.desc: Dry Bar Comedy, Utah’s only clean stand-up club, welcomes to the stage a comic recognized in the industry for his unbeatable laughs-per-minute record.

programme.title: Yakov Smirnoff: United We Laugh
programme.desc: The iconic Russian comedian delivers hilarious and touching words and scenarios that bring people together in this live 2020 performance.

programme.title: Yakov Smirnoff: What a Country!
programme.desc: Ukranian comic Yakov Smirnoff swings a hammer and sickle at life in America and Soviet Russia in this side-splitting Cold War-era standup special.

programme.title: Jill-Michele Meleán: White/Latina
programme.desc: The half-Bolivian, half-Irish comic talks about navigating vastly different cultural identities while creating her own brand of funny.

programme.title: Anjelah Johnson: Mahalo & Goodnight
programme.desc: In her fourth stand-up comedy special, Anjelah Johnson dishes on awkward massages, home invasions, spiders, and being a full-grown child.

programme.title: Anjelah Johnson: The Homecoming Show
programme.desc: The comic shares her stories of growing up with a sports enthusiast father who never wanted to pay for athletic training, and other hilarious tales.

programme.title: Leanne Morgan: So Yummy
programme.desc: The stand up comic discusses dogs, cheerleading camp, the struggles of being an empty nester, and joining Weight Watchers for the 7th time.

programme.title: Tj: January 3rd
programme.desc: After eight years performing in America, Haitian-born stand-up comedian Tanael Joachim debuts his first TV special. Recorded live in Brooklyn.

programme.title: Larry Omaha: Freaky Times in a Freaky World
programme.desc: The hilarious comedian discusses growing up with three older sisters, attempting to prove his masculinity to his father, and so much more.

programme.title: Marc Yaffee: Mid-Laugh Crisis
programme.desc: The Native American comedian, writer, actor, and podcast host gives his hottest takes on traveling to small “international” airports, and more.

programme.title: 1 vs. 100
programme.desc: Professional dancer Carrie Ann Inaba hosts this show in which a contestant can win $50,000. The contestant, known as the One, competes with a mob of 100 other players by answering questions. When the One answers correctly, each member of the mob that answered incorrectly is eliminated. The One earns money for each mob member who is eliminated. If the One can eliminate the entire mob, he wins $50,000. But if the One gets a question wrong, he is eliminated and the remaining mob members split his winnings.

programme.title: Family Feud
programme.desc: Steve Harvey assumes the hosting duties for this daytime game show in which five members of one family are pitted against five members of another family. The winning family gets a chance to earn extra cash in a bonus round.

programme.title: Wipeout Australia
programme.desc: This week contestants on Wipeout Australia are bought undone by a seemingly simple obstacle on the Qualifier, the Slippery Stairs. It’s all in the name really, an innocent set of stairs, covered in Wipeout Crash cream. Its up the way and down the way for all and sundry. The lucky 12 that move through, battle it out with a giant toothbrush Sweeper. ‘Nat with the Tats’ and Renee ‘Lets get physical’ move through to the Dreadmill, flying the banner for the ladies. Look out for Scotty Six Toes at the Big Balls and get the ear plugs ready as you meet Herr Chris. It’s a colourful week with leotards, laughs and lots of ladies.

programme.title: An American Werewolf in Paris
programme.desc: An American tourist finds himself becoming involved with a French woman who also happens to be able to supernaturally turn into a werewolf.

programme.title: The Pit

programme.title: Spiders

programme.title: Raging Sharks

programme.title: Phantom Racer

programme.title: The Pumpkin Karver

programme.title: Battledogs

programme.title: The Bone Snatcher

programme.title: Paranormal Entity

programme.title: Octopus

programme.title: Ticks

programme.title: Maneater
programme.desc: When an escaped Bengal tiger terrorizes a small Appalachian town, it’s up to the local sheriff, a game-hunter, and a gifted boy to stop the creature.

programme.title: Phantasm: Remastered
programme.desc: The residents of a small town have begun dying under strange circumstances, leading young Mike (Michael Baldwin) to investigate. After discovering that the Tall Man (Angus Scrimm), the town's mortician, is killing and reanimating the dead as misshapen zombies, Mike seeks help from his older brother, Jody (Bill Thornbury), and local ice cream man Reggie (Reggie Bannister). Working together, they try to lure out and kill the Tall Man, all the while avoiding his minions and a deadly silver sphere.

programme.title: Phantasm III: Lord of the Dead
programme.desc: The evil alien known as the Tall Man (Angus Scrimm) has infiltrated the minds of Mike (A. Michael Baldwin) and Reggie (Reggie Bannister). The two friends embark on a journey to find and kill him, only to discover that he has destroyed town after town, leaving zombies in place of the living. Along the way, Mike and Reggie meet several characters who share their goal, including a murderous boy named Tim (Kevin Connors) and two young women who are excellent fighters.

programme.title: Phantasm IV: Oblivion
programme.desc: Mike escapes the Tall Man, who’d begun to transform him, leaving Reggie to hop dimensions until he finds the truth about the night his brother died.

programme.title: Phantasm: Ravager
programme.desc: The phantasm nightmare comes to an end as reality blurs for a hero in search of his friend and out to vanquish a villain who can be two places at once

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don prepares the flowering borders for winter and makes a bonfire, Carol celebrates our berry-laden hedgerows, and Rachel visits Julian Clary in his garden.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: With autumn fast approaching, Monty is preparing the borders for the change of seasons and looking ahead to spring. Adam Frost and Advolly Richmond visit a glorious historic garden in North Yorkshire - Scampston Hall.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: At Longmeadow, Monty is planning for next summer by sowing a batch of sweet peas. Meanwhile, Carol Klein is amongst the leaves, bark and berries at Thorp Perrow Arboretum in Yorkshire admiring the onset of the autumn display. Plus, there's a visit to Ryton Gardens in Warwickshire to find out about their collection of heritage vegetables and how to collect their seeds.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: As the plants in the jewel garden reach the peak of their late summer glory, Monty starts planning for the spring when he plants ferns and gives advice on the care and maintenance of wildlife ponds.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don tackles the perennial problem of what to grow in the shade beneath a tree, Carol Klein takes a look at the crocosmia and we meet a gardener in Derbyshire who has spent a lifetime growing and showing gladioli.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: In the cottage garden, Monty is moving a rose which has outgrown its space and in the vegetable garden he gives advice on what to plant now for spring. He also finds out more about the mysterious world of earthworms and discovers why they are vital for the garden.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: With autumn just around the corner, Adam takes stock of his garden and plans ahead for some late-season interest under the supervision of Ash the cat. Plus, Frances visits a garden in Kent where the plants provide a non-stop buffet for insects.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: As autumn unfolds in the garden, Monty Don has plenty to be getting on with at Longmeadow. In his quest to track down some of the nations most remarkable allotments, Joe Swift visits a tropical paradise in Runcorn.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: As Monty brings in the summer harvest, he gives advice on what to sow to keep the crops coming up to the end of Autumn. Carol Klein visits a woman who is losing her eyesight and gives her recommendations of plants that will be a feast for her senses.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: The vegetable garden is at its peak now and as well as harvesting, Monty takes a look at how his autumn crops are faring as well as giving tips on how to keep the garden looking at its best. Adam Frost returns to Leicester where he has been helping to create a garden from scratch on a new build estate, and Frances Tophill celebrates the summer harvest on her shared allotment.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: At Longmeadow this week, Monty reaps a harvest from the vegetable garden, plants up a seasonal pot and gives a masterclass on how to make the perfect compost. Adam Frost travels to York to meet a couple who took on 20 acres of land and filled it with flowers.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty shows how to take cuttings from herbs, prune summer raspberries and plant daylilies. Meanwhile, Adam travels to Whitstable on the Kent coast to see how gardeners cope with the wild, wet and windy weather.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Adam Frost and Advolly Richmond celebrate the horticultural genius of William Robinson in the gardens of his former home, Gravetye Manor in Sussex. Fresh off the back of her success at Hampton Court Palace Garden Festival, Sue Kent gives her own garden some TLC and creates a special container display using small pots. There's also a passionate grower in London who uses every available space in his garden to grow a vast range of vegetables.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty and the team celebrate the wonder of trees and explore the vital role they play in gardens and the wider landscape. Zoe Ball joins Toby Buckland on a visit to a tree project in North London.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: This time there's plenty to do to prepare for the season to come and Monty Don is clearing out spent crops and mulching his asparagus. Joe Swift's been to visit keen gardeners, Wayne and Geraldine Hemingway, to see how they combine sustainability with their designer-style. Carol Klein's exploring the history of the rose at Coughton Court, one of our best rose gardens and Monty plants a new rose of his own. What happens when you have to downsize and leave your much-loved garden?

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: With autumn on the horizon, the seasonal planting of bulbs for spring-flowering begins at Longmeadow. Frances Tophill meets a gardener whose allotment is filled with both traditional and exotic vegetables and Toby Buckland visits The Newt in Somerset to find out about its chequered garden history and to explore its emergence as one of the UK's most exciting gardens.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: At Longmeadow Monty checks the progress of the potatoes he planted earlier in the year and recommends plants for dry shade under trees.We travel to Somerset to get water saving tips from a water scientist who uses a variety of techniques to save as much water as possible in her own garden and we meet a gardener who has filled his home with over one thousand houseplants.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: At Longmeadow Monty is planting bulbs in pots and around the garden for an explosion of spring colour. Carol Klein travels to Yorkshire where she takes a close look at the enormous colour range and form of a late season perennial, the salvia. Mark Lane is in Oxfordshire looking at how ornamental grasses can be used in planting design to create exciting combinations.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty's thoughts turn to spring when he gives recommendations for bulbs to plant that will thrive in pots. He also shows how to prune summer fruiting raspberries. In Norfolk, Frances Tophill visits a gardener who at 97 still gardens every day.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: A celebration of people who are growing their own, from vegetables to flowers, across the UK. At Longmeadow, Monty shares tips and advice on how to get the most out of bargain plants. Meanwhile, Joe visits an extraordinary food project in Bristol.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: With the arrival of October, it is time to start thinking about getting some onions and garlic in the ground, and Monty Don shares his secrets on how to get a successful crop. Elsewhere, Carol Klein takes first-time gardeners Dan and Dominique for a day out in Devon. They are on the hunt for some seasonal inspiration for their new garden and what better place to look than RHS Rosemoor.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: In the fourth of her films about botany, Carol Klein explores the inner workings of leaves - how they harness the sun's energy and turn it into food. Joe Swift meets Griff Rhys Jones for a private tour of his remarkable garden and discovers what a passionate gardener he is.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don is at Longmeadow with a host of seasonal jobs to keep his autumn garden looking beautiful for as long as possible, and in the third of her fascinating films about how plants work, Carol Klein investigates the science of stems.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty shows how to stake dahlias, sows seeds of perennials and celebrates an abundant vegetable harvest. The team meet a landscape designer in Cornwall who creates gardens that are not only sustainable but also beautiful and edible.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Gardeners' World comes from the RHS Hampton Court Palace Garden Festival. Adam Frost, Carol Klein and Joe Swift reveal the highlights of the show gardens, meet the designers and growers and share the season's must have flowers and plants on display.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty is back at Longmeadow, getting stuck into some seasonal jobs. Arit Anderson and Nick Bailey present highlights from RHS Flower Show Tatton Park, and Carol Klein visits a garden in Somerset.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty shows how to deal with drought, takes fuchsia cuttings and demonstrates how to summer prune fruit trees. Advolly Richmond reveals the important role that trees have played in gardens throughout history on a visit to Longleat. There's also a catch-up with three sisters in Dorset who developed a love of gardening during lockdown, this time, they plant up two beds, one for sun and one for shade.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty sows rocket, harvests chillies and tomatoes, and demonstrates how to take semi-ripe cuttings. Frances Tophill meets a head gardener in south London who's started gardening sustainably.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty undertakes more seasonal jobs at Longmeadow. Arit Anderson meets a garden designer in Somerset who has worked in harmony with nature to create a garden on a former brownfield site.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty is back at Longmeadow, getting stuck into more seasonal tasks. Joe Swift heads to Houghton Lodge Gardens in Hampshire renowned for its walled kitchen garden and heritage fruit collection.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don gets going with some autumn garden maintenance whilst looking back over the year and reviewing his borders - which plants have done well and others that haven't. As he clears annuals that are past their best he plans a colourful display for late spring by planting up the garden with tulips. Carol Klein is at Glebe Cottage continuing work on her new raised beds and taming an overgrown and unruly rambling rose.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: In the cottage garden, Monty is moving a rose which has outgrown its space and in the vegetable garden he gives advice on what to plant now for spring. He also finds out more about the mysterious world of earthworms and discovers why they are vital for the garden.

programme.title: Monty Don's American Gardens
programme.desc: Monty travels from Missouri to Chicago and then across to New York and Philadelphia. He begins his journey in a prairie, the original American flowering wilderness. Much of the prairie has disappeared but he meets a couple who have revived the tradition and enjoy showing it to him in full bloom.

programme.title: Monty Don's American Gardens
programme.desc: Monty goes South to explore gardens of early independent America and learns how the history of this part of the country is still very much evident in the places and people he meets. He visits the famous garden where President Thomas Jefferson, one of America's founding fathers, enjoyed spending his time seeking out seeds and plants for his thousand foot vegetable garden.

programme.title: Monty Don's American Gardens
programme.desc: Monty explores the extraordinary scenery of the west coast of America. He begins his journey in Arizona where he learns about cacti and marvels at the sight of them in the desert and in private gardens where they have replaced traditional plants and lawns.

programme.title: Monty Don's Adriatic Gardens
programme.desc: Monty travels to Europe and explores the influence of the Venetians on gardening. To begin with, he explores Venice on one of the city's famous barges, stepping out to visit green spaces large and small that are often hidden from view behind high walls.

programme.title: Monty Don's Adriatic Gardens
programme.desc: Monty begins in the city of Trieste, close to Italy's border with Croatia, to visit a public garden first created by an obsessive royal plantsman more than 150 years ago, which is now being carefully restored. He then heads down the Adriatic coast through Croatia to pick up the trail that the Venetians followed, ending his journey on the beautiful island of Lopud, near Dubrovnik.

programme.title: Monty Don's Adriatic Gardens
programme.desc: Monty begins the last leg of his journey in Corfu, a Greek island with strong Venetian links, including olive trees planted by them that are still grown today. Here, Monty visits a spectacular garden made by an Englishman with Greek connections.

programme.title: Monty Don's British Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don travels from the north west coast of Scotland to the north east coast of England, from historic reconstructions to modern re-inventions. He visits some of the most inhospitable places in the country and finds gardens that are flourishing.

programme.title: Monty Don's British Gardens
programme.desc: Monty travels across some of the country's landscapes, heading across the north of England to Northern Ireland. Here, Monty sees the ingenuity, passion and determination of British people to garden and create gardens, no matter what the canvas.

programme.title: Monty Don's British Gardens
programme.desc: Monty travels across the middle of the country, from Wales to Norfolk. He comes across gardens for gnomes, much-loved, well-tended allotments and extravagant gardens that bankrupted their owners.

programme.title: Monty Don's British Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don explores the most densely populated part of the country, London and the home counties. He visits some of London's gardens, including a special one on a barge, as well as a beautifully restored garden close to where he grew up in Hampshire.

programme.title: Monty Don's British Gardens
programme.desc: Monty travels across the south west of the country to visit some of Britain's most exotic gardens. On this journey, Monty also goes to some of the country's most historic gardens, as well as some challenging contemporary ones.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty and the team celebrate the wonder of trees and explore the vital role they play in gardens and the wider landscape. Zoe Ball joins Toby Buckland on a visit to a tree project in North London.

programme.title: Canadian Whitetail
programme.desc: Part 1 of Taylors Excalibur Crossbow hunt for an ancient Boone and Crocket typical.

programme.title: HuntStand Presents
programme.desc: Hunting has a way of grounding us, reminding us of what truly matters: shared moments and unforgettable memories. Chance and Ashleigh Eckert are on their first out-of-state hunt in the rolling hills of Ohio. After overcoming a life-changing kidney transplant, their story is one of faith, love, and resilience. While the goal was a big buck, the true reward was the time spent together and the lessons learned along the way. Because hunting is about so much more than the harvest — it’s about the journey.

programme.title: Hunting Land Man
programme.desc: Opening day in Mississippi has arrived and Slade is taking full advantage of it! With the weather not cooperating Slade and Zeb stumble into a turkey hunt they won't soon forget. Two days later, the hot streak continues with Slade connecting on another turkey on an 83 acre property he has for sale! Also, Slade gives some tips and his ideas on small acreage hunting, and how it can be just as lucrative as big tracks of land!

programme.title: The Hunted Land & Sea
programme.desc: Kristian's father Kim Hansen and close friend Gerry Holland travel to Kona for some deep-sea fishing aboard the “Kona Blue” with long time friend Caption Marlin Kahl.

programme.title: Behind The Draw
programme.desc: When you think of hunting Colorado, Big Whitetails might not necessarily come to mind. However, Mike is very familiar with Eastern Colorado and the whitetails here specifically. He has hunted with his friends that run this ranch for years now and helped them manage this special piece of land. There is an absolutely, incredible age class of deer that live here with some of the most unique hunting Colorado has to offer. In this particular story Mike takes his bow-hunt down to the final day of his hunt while he is after a certain buck they've nicknamed "Buddy".

programme.title: The Green Way Outdoors
programme.desc: Kyle and Jeff embark on a 20-day mission into the Everglades to find the invasive pythons that are plaguing the ecosystem. These apex predators have eliminated more than 90% of fur-bearing animals in their new home. Can they turn the tide, or is the Everglades already lost?

programme.title: The Green Way Outdoors
programme.desc: Kyle and Jeff get bit by catfish in Southern Oklahoma with YouTuber Nate Williams of Adrenaline Rush Adventures while using the most primitive fishing tactic - hand fishing. Learn from the Chickasaw Nation about the history of this method that has been used by Native Americans for thousands of years.

programme.title: The Green Way Outdoors
programme.desc: Kyle and Jeff dive into the wild waters off Hawaii’s coast, coming face-to-face with sharks and graceful manta rays. The adrenaline peaks when Kyle takes a heart-pounding leap off a towering 40-foot cliff, making this adventure as daring as it is unforgettable.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: When overnight temps go low and the tides go lower, it forces Redfish to move. Justin & Travis break out a new micro skiff to see how low they can go to ambush shifting redfish on the flats.

programme.desc: World record fly fisherman Nathaniel Linville shares his journey from troubled youth and addiction to redemption through fly fishing. programme.desc: Charles Rodney’s relationship with his hunting dogs, passion for field-to-table living and connection to the land make his love for chasing rabbits contagious while the heritage of Winchester’s small game ammunition makes this beloved pastime accessible for generations to come. programme.title: Louisiana Catch and Cook
programme.desc: We're BACK in Lafitte continuing our adventure in Jefferson Parish. Join Louisiana Celebrity Chef Jay Ducote (known as the guy who beat Bobby Flay), alongside Philadelphia's own Chef Brian Duffy (famous from Bar Rescue), as we pick up where we left off because this much flavor couldn't be contained in a single episode. Jump in as we finish our catch and head down to the BEAUTIFUL Restaurant Des Families for dinner on the bayou. Back at Elsa's Place, we keep the feast going and enjoy the camaraderie at our camp. Just a quick drive down from New Orleans Airport. Don't miss out on the fun. Book your trip today at www.LouisianaCharterFishing.com!

programme.title: Louisiana Catch and Cook
programme.desc: In this episode, Chef Jay Ducote brings along a very special fishing buddy, his dad, for our first-ever Catch & Cook freshwater adventure! We’re heading to the legendary Toledo Bend, famous for its sac-a-lait (Cajun for crappie) and ranked among the top bass lakes in the U.S. It’s a bucket-list stop for anglers everywhere, but trust us, the story doesn’t end with the fish.Steeped in Spanish, French, and Native American roots dating back to the Louisiana Purchase, this region serves up culture and flavor as rich as its fishing. We’ll be staying at Wildwood Resort, hitting the water with Captain Matt Loetscher of Living The Dream Guide Service, and capping off the day with spectacular lake views from their breezy lakeside bar.Hook, line, and sinker — you don’t want to miss this one!Ready to go catchin’ with one of Louisiana’s best captains? Visit www.LouisianaCharterFishing.com to check availability or book your trip today!

Ali and Rush switch their targets from the jumbo size Bluefin Tuna to a smaller, medium grade fish for non-stop run and gun action. But, with so many fish fixated on the masses of bait in the area, it may take a million casts to pull one out of the froth.

programme.title: TRP
programme.desc: Today we’re talking with Nick Haddad about his innovative fishing conservation initiative, "Return 'Em Right," focused on boosting the survival rates of reef fish caught and released in the Gulf of Mexico. Teaming up with Florida Sea Grant, University of Florida, Gulf States Marine Fisheries Commission, NOAA, and a diverse coalition of partners, the project delivers training, equipment, and research funding to tackle depredation and release mortality issues. programme.title: Realtree Road Trips
programme.desc: October is here. We start out in Nebraska, head to Kansas and end up in Georgia. Many people have been impacted by the recent hurricanes. To help those in need we are hunting does and will donate as much venison as we possibly can to the victims.

programme.title: Realtree Road Trips
programme.desc: Realtree's Tyler Jordan and Michael Pitts hunt the tail end of the rut in Georgia. The bucks are still chasing the remaining does in heat as the weather cools off in the south.

programme.title: Realtree Road Trips
programme.desc: After 3 years, Tyler kills “Stomper,Jr.” and he just might be the new Louisiana state record buck. We scored him at 203" gross and 193" net typical. We thoroughly enjoyed chasing this magnificent animal in Louisiana with our good buddies Drew Keith and Cole Cooper. Hope you enjoy watching this video just as much as we enjoyed putting it together!

programme.title: Realtree Road Trips
programme.desc: Join Bryan Brown, Rigsby Stewart, and Chase Herndon along with Lee Ellis on our annual opening week hunt in Northern Nebraska. Big Bucks were spotted and a tag was punched on an unexpected buck on opening day!

programme.title: Flats Class

programme.title: Flats Class

programme.title: The Cast
programme.desc: Trenton and Rex link up with Gehrig Dieter and Anthony Sherman from the Kansas City Chiefs. While filling the boat with crappie they got to learn about the guys and their careers in the NFL.

programme.title: The Cast
programme.desc: The Southards are heads to Table Rock for the annual family vacation. Receding water poses a challenge but there’s no lack of fish or laughs at the lake!

programme.title: Beyond The Surface
programme.desc: Today, Capt. Danny is joined by his son Dillan for a plug-filled day in their local waters of Cedar Key, FL!

programme.title: Beyond The Surface
programme.desc: Today, Capt. Danny is in Stuart, FL. Joined by 16-year-old angler, Denton Potter. The two are targeting the local bridge dwelling giants, while going “Beyond The Surface” into Denton’s story.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: Nikki Boxler’s life in Update New York on her family farm raising cattle and producing maple syrup is a few thousand miles from the hills of New Mexico. We’ll take a look into Nikki’s life back home and then follow along as she visits the small town of Quemado and its bustling population of 228, while she pursues bugling elk with her favorite Winchester in hand. We’ll also head to Missouri and Texas to chase whitetails with Chris Keefer and Paul Sawyer.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: We set out to tell the tale of Marion - and his legendary Mack’s Prairie Wings, smack dab in the middle of the world famous Stuttgart, Arkansas - the land of ducks and rice. Get an inside look at a man that many consider to be larger than life, from those that knew him best, like his cousin and fellow hell raiser, Bud McCollum. We’ll even hear a story or two from Milton Stovesand, an 81 year old former waterfowl guide and Mack’s employee who actually guided John Olin a time or two, and ran the timber holes with Marion. It’s timber holes and tall tales. It’s cups of coffee and cupped up wings. It’s partners in business, and partners in potholes and it’s pure Arkansas...just like Marion.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: Melissa Bachman has made her name over the last two decades as one of the most dedicated hunters and producers in the outdoor industry. In this episode we’ll tag along with Melissa while she chases big game around the world with her Winchester in hand. First, we’ll head to Prince of Whales Island as Melissa tries to catch up to a giant black bear, then travel across the pond to chase mountain ibex, New Zealand for tar, and back to the states for whitetail.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: Shotgun sports are experiencing unprecedented growth, with competitions across the country gaining popularity as enthusiasts vie to be the best shooters in the world. Every summer, the Amateur Trapshooting Association hosts The Grand American in Sparta, Illinois. This year marks the 125th Anniversary for the largest trap shooting competition in the world. We’ll talk with the people who make this tournament run behind the scenes and explore what makes this tournament such a special event. We’ll also look at the rich history of The Grand. On-site we’ll chat with the curator of the Trapshooting Hall of Fame and look at some of the incredible historical pieces on display in the museum. Additionally, we’ll learn about White Flyer and how the clay manufacturer has made important innovations for the shotgun sports.
Follow Team200’s crew of traditional archers as they chase bigwhitetails in Canada!

programme.title: Global Getaway
programme.desc: This week on Getaway Nicky Buckley winds up our Christmas Markets cruise in Europe, enjoying all the festive favorites through Germany and into Amsterdam.

programme.title: Realtree Roadtrips
programme.desc: Tyler Jordan is hunting a true giant at one of his favorite places to hunt in the Southeast. Honeybrake has been a great place to deer hunt for the Realtree crew over the last few years. Tyler Jordan and Ben McDonald decide to try their luck bowhunting at Honeybrake for a couple true southern ghosts.

programme.title: Beyond The Surface
programme.desc: On this episode Capt. Danny joins Capt. James Kerr in the legendary waters of Crystal River, Florida. The two of them are targeting the fan favorite redfish, while going Beyond The Surface in the world of James Kerr.

programme.title: Canadian Whitetail
programme.desc: Part 1 of Taylors Excalibur Crossbow hunt for an ancient Boone and Crocket typical.

programme.title: HuntStand Presents
programme.desc: Hunting has a way of grounding us, reminding us of what truly matters: shared moments and unforgettable memories. Chance and Ashleigh Eckert are on their first out-of-state hunt in the rolling hills of Ohio. After overcoming a life-changing kidney transplant, their story is one of faith, love, and resilience. While the goal was a big buck, the true reward was the time spent together and the lessons learned along the way. Because hunting is about so much more than the harvest — it’s about the journey.

programme.title: Hunting Land Man
programme.desc: Opening day in Mississippi has arrived and Slade is taking full advantage of it! With the weather not cooperating Slade and Zeb stumble into a turkey hunt they won't soon forget. Two days later, the hot streak continues with Slade connecting on another turkey on an 83 acre property he has for sale! Also, Slade gives some tips and his ideas on small acreage hunting, and how it can be just as lucrative as big tracks of land!

programme.title: The Hunted Land & Sea

programme.title: Behind The Draw
programme.desc: When you think of hunting Colorado, Big Whitetails might not necessarily come to mind. However, Mike is very familiar with Eastern Colorado and the whitetails here specifically. He has hunted with his friends that run this ranch for years now and helped them manage this special piece of land. There is an absolutely, incredible age class of deer that live here with some of the most unique hunting Colorado has to offer. In this particular story Mike takes his bow-hunt down to the final day of his hunt while he is after a certain buck they've nicknamed "Buddy".

programme.title: The Green Way Outdoors
programme.desc: Kyle and Jeff embark on a 20-day mission into the Everglades to find the invasive pythons that are plaguing the ecosystem. These apex predators have eliminated more than 90% of fur-bearing animals in their new home. Can they turn the tide, or is the Everglades already lost?

programme.title: The Green Way Outdoors
programme.desc: Kyle and Jeff get bit by catfish in Southern Oklahoma with YouTuber Nate Williams of Adrenaline Rush Adventures while using the most primitive fishing tactic - hand fishing. Learn from the Chickasaw Nation about the history of this method that has been used by Native Americans for thousands of years.

programme.title: The Green Way Outdoors
programme.desc: Kyle and Jeff dive into the wild waters off Hawaii’s coast, coming face-to-face with sharks and graceful manta rays. The adrenaline peaks when Kyle takes a heart-pounding leap off a towering 40-foot cliff, making this adventure as daring as it is unforgettable.

programme.title: Louisiana Catch and Cook
programme.desc: We're BACK in Lafitte continuing our adventure in Jefferson Parish. Join Louisiana Celebrity Chef Jay Ducote (known as the guy who beat Bobby Flay), alongside Philadelphia's own Chef Brian Duffy (famous from Bar Rescue), as we pick up where we left off because this much flavor couldn't be contained in a single episode. Jump in as we finish our catch and head down to the BEAUTIFUL Restaurant Des Families for dinner on the bayou. Back at Elsa's Place, we keep the feast going and enjoy the camaraderie at our camp. Just a quick drive down from New Orleans Airport. Don't miss out on the fun. Book your trip today at www.LouisianaCharterFishing.com!

programme.title: Louisiana Catch and Cook
programme.desc: In this episode, Chef Jay Ducote brings along a very special fishing buddy, his dad, for our first-ever Catch & Cook freshwater adventure! We’re heading to the legendary Toledo Bend, famous for its sac-a-lait (Cajun for crappie) and ranked among the top bass lakes in the U.S. It’s a bucket-list stop for anglers everywhere, but trust us, the story doesn’t end with the fish.Steeped in Spanish, French, and Native American roots dating back to the Louisiana Purchase, this region serves up culture and flavor as rich as its fishing. We’ll be staying at Wildwood Resort, hitting the water with Captain Matt Loetscher of Living The Dream Guide Service, and capping off the day with spectacular lake views from their breezy lakeside bar.Hook, line, and sinker — you don’t want to miss this one!Ready to go catchin’ with one of Louisiana’s best captains? Visit www.LouisianaCharterFishing.com to check availability or book your trip today!

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: Nikki Boxler’s life in Update New York on her family farm raising cattle and producing maple syrup is a few thousand miles from the hills of New Mexico. We’ll take a look into Nikki’s life back home and then follow along as she visits the small town of Quemado and its bustling population of 228, while she pursues bugling elk with her favorite Winchester in hand. We’ll also head to Missouri and Texas to chase whitetails with Chris Keefer and Paul Sawyer.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: We set out to tell the tale of Marion - and his legendary Mack’s Prairie Wings, smack dab in the middle of the world famous Stuttgart, Arkansas - the land of ducks and rice. Get an inside look at a man that many consider to be larger than life, from those that knew him best, like his cousin and fellow hell raiser, Bud McCollum. We’ll even hear a story or two from Milton Stovesand, an 81 year old former waterfowl guide and Mack’s employee who actually guided John Olin a time or two, and ran the timber holes with Marion. It’s timber holes and tall tales. It’s cups of coffee and cupped up wings. It’s partners in business, and partners in potholes and it’s pure Arkansas...just like Marion.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: Melissa Bachman has made her name over the last two decades as one of the most dedicated hunters and producers in the outdoor industry. In this episode we’ll tag along with Melissa while she chases big game around the world with her Winchester in hand. First, we’ll head to Prince of Whales Island as Melissa tries to catch up to a giant black bear, then travel across the pond to chase mountain ibex, New Zealand for tar, and back to the states for whitetail.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: Shotgun sports are experiencing unprecedented growth, with competitions across the country gaining popularity as enthusiasts vie to be the best shooters in the world. Every summer, the Amateur Trapshooting Association hosts The Grand American in Sparta, Illinois. This year marks the 125th Anniversary for the largest trap shooting competition in the world. We’ll talk with the people who make this tournament run behind the scenes and explore what makes this tournament such a special event. We’ll also look at the rich history of The Grand. On-site we’ll chat with the curator of the Trapshooting Hall of Fame and look at some of the incredible historical pieces on display in the museum. Additionally, we’ll learn about White Flyer and how the clay manufacturer has made important innovations for the shotgun sports.
Follow Team200’s crew of traditional archers as they chase bigwhitetails in Canada!

programme.desc: A hilarious comedy about a perpetual adolescent who's forced to deal with his aging, unloving father when his mother leaves him flat.

programme.title: Postcards From the Edge

programme.title: Fire on the Mountain

programme.title: The Shadow Riders

When Bonnie Lee (Jean Arthur), a performer who is falling for him, sees that Geoff is preparing to fly in violent weather conditions, she takes measures to make him stay. She's successful in her attempt, and two of his employees are forced to make the flight for him -- but Bonnie may have been correct about the potential peril of that flight.

programme.desc: When a brash reporter starts trailing a runaway heiress on her bus trip from Florida to New York for a big scoop, can love be far behind?

But as Mary's illness progresses, keeping it a secret presents a considerable challenge.

programme.title: Smoky Canyon
programme.desc: The masked Durango Kid (Charles Starrett) settles a feud between cattlemen and sheepmen.

programme.title: The Nevadan

programme.title: The Last Posse

programme.title: Hangman's Knot
programme.desc: Major Matt Stewart (Randolph Scott) leads a troop of Confederate soldiers on a raid, targeting a wagon that is transporting Union gold. All of the Union soldiers are killed except for one, who informs Stewart that the war had already ended a month ago. Stewart leads the troop into hiding, knowing they could face murder charges. After capturing a coach driven by nurse Molly Hull (Donna Reed), the soldiers try to evade a group of bandits chasing them to steal the gold.

programme.desc: In the 1870s, Marshal Wyatt Earp (Bruce Cowling) calls upon Dodge City, Kan., Sheriff Bat Masterson (George Montgomery) to track down rancher Merrick (John Maxwell), who is accused of murder. But, thanks to some proof held by local Native American Chief Yellow Hawk (Jay Silverheels), Masterson realizes Merrick might be the victim of a frame-up. So, with the help of Earp and gunfighter Doc Holliday (James Griffith), Masterson sets out to find those who are really behind the killing.

programme.title: The Black Dakotas
programme.desc: A Confederate plot to turn the Sioux against the Union crumbles when a double agent makes off with a shipment of gold.

programme.title: Jubal
programme.desc: Searching for work, cowboy Jubal Troop (Glenn Ford) arrives in a small town, where he badly injures his hand. Fortunately, a local rancher, Shep Horgan (Ernest Borgnine), is willing to employ Troop despite the injury. Horgan and Troop work together amicably, but Horgan's two-timing wife (Valerie French) threatens to create discord when she becomes interested in Troop, although he really loves another woman. A jealous cowhand (Rod Steiger) complicates matters by spreading lies.

programme.title: Adventures in Silverado
programme.desc: Based on the Robert Louis Stevenson book "The Silverado Squatters."

When his brother, muckraking newspaper editor Roy Carlin (Víctor Vilanova), is murdered after printing an exposé of Starr's crooked deals, Carlin returns home from the Mexican border town where he's been holed up and enlists his brother's fiancée (Luz Márquez) and saloon dancer Kit O'Neal (Diana Lorys) to bring Starr down.

programme.title: Return to Warbow
programme.desc: Three escaped convicts return to collect the money that the brother of one of them has already spent.

programme.title: The Violent Men

Robinson), the scheming businessman interested in his property, make Parrish reconsider the move, especially after one of his ranch hands is murdered. Adding to the increasingly tense conflict is Wilkison's wife, Martha (Barbara Stanwyck), who is cheating on her husband with his brother, Cole (Brian Keith).

programme.title: Comanche Station
programme.desc: When solitary cowboy Jefferson Cody (Randolph Scott) hears tales of a white woman living as a captive of the Comanche tribe, he rides deep into the tribe's territory to exchange goods for her freedom. As Cody escorts the captive woman away, he learns that she is Nancy Lowe (Nancy Gates), and that there is a sizable reward offered by her husband for her return. Cody and Mrs. Lowe must brave ruthless bounty hunters greedy for the reward, as well as the now-warring Comanches, to make it to safety.

programme.title: Major Dundee
programme.desc: During the end of the Civil War, Major Dundee guards Confederate prisoners, Union deserters and ordinary hard-bitten criminals in a remote fort. When Apaches attack the fort and make off with three children, Dundee must set up a posse including Confederates, who face a choice between joining up or being shot. The feud between Dundee and Tyreen is also heated up by a sultry Mexican widow.

programme.title: The Guns of Fort Petticoat
programme.desc: Texan and U.S. Cavalryman Lt. Frank Hewitt (Audie Murphy) deserts the army after Colorado Union soldiers carry out the deadly Sand Creek reservation massacre, fearing reprisal from the Cheyenne. Crossing into Texas, Franks finds himself labeled a traitor for fighting with the Yankees, and his warnings about possible Indian revenge go unheeded. When a town near a mission, populated mostly by women, is attacked, Frank is appointed their protector and must build an army comprised of townswomen.

He soon finds himself in the middle of the conflict, however, when a confederate colonel (Richard Widmark) captures the rancher and forces Kelly to help his soldiers steal a nearby herd of cattle, which they desperately need for food.
